body:
### ESLint version

HEAD

### What problem do you want to solve?

Currently, if the ESLint CLI is run in eslintrc mode, we output the following message:

> You are using an eslintrc configuration file, which is deprecated and support will be removed in v10.0.0. Please migrate to an eslint.config.js file. See https://eslint.org/docs/latest/use/configure/migration-guide for details.

As reported in [this discussion](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/discussions/18456?notification_referrer_id=NT_kwDNlpKxMTA2NzMwMDEwMzg6Mzg1NDY&notifications_query=reason%3Amention#discussioncomment-10904454), this doesn't really give enough context to figure out why ESLint is running in eslintrc mode.

### What do you think is the correct solution?

Update the error message to contain the following information:

1. If `ESLINT_USE_FLAT_CONFIG=false` is explicitly set. The poster in the previously mentioned comment had this set from a previous installation and it took a while to realize it.
2. If possible, the location of the configuration file used. I'm not sure how easy it will be to get this info, but it's worth looking into.

### Participation

- [ ] I am willing to submit a pull request for this change.

### Additional comments

_No response_
